When you seek a second opinion from a doctor in Singapore, you should have care that addresses your medical, emotional, and practical needs.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eAt Thomson OncoCare Cancer Centre, our medical oncologists work with you to plan each stage of your treatment and ensure you have the information and resources to make informed choices. Where you wish, your loved ones can be involved in these discussions, so that support is present throughout your journey.\u003c/p\u003e","accordion_list":{"title":"","accordion_item":[]},"pill_video":null,"pill_image":{"uid":"blt9171e059e69f09be","_content_type_uid":"sys_assets","metadata":{"preset":{},"extension_uid":"blt98839f2d621515f6"},"asset":{"uid":"blt9171e059e69f09be","_version":3,"title":"TOCC Landing Page Hero.png","created_by":"blt974ab6796946f14d","updated_by":"blt974ab6796946f14d","created_at":"2025-05-21T11:54:47.239Z","updated_at":"2025-07-09T10:40:46.826Z","content_type":"image/png","file_size":"967888","filename":"TOCC_Landing_Hero_Page.png","ACL":{},"parent_uid":null,"is_dir":false,"tags":[],"description":"","publish_details":{"time":"2025-08-24T15:28:55.416Z","user":"bltdae2747734443432","environment":"bltff9d25f6ec56a47a","locale":"en-gb"},"url":"https://images.contentstack.io/v3/assets/blt5f400315f9e4f0b3/blt9171e059e69f09be/686e4726e39359a54ee32136/TOCC_Landing_Hero_Page.png?branch=prod"}},"pill_image_alignment":"top-aligned","cta":{"title":"Speak With Us Today","cta_type":"button","site_page":[{"uid":"blte33e2de8b9c8e915","_content_type_uid":"form"}],"external_link":"","tracking_code":"","target":null},"showgradient":false}},{"left_aligned_title_with_accordion":{"title":"When to Consider a Second Opinion Doctor for Cancer Treatment","_metadata":{"uid":"csa6ae5e1fafee0682"},"nav_title":"When To Consider","accordion_list":{"title":"Here are some reasons to consider:","accordion_item":[{"title":"Reasons Patients Seek a Second Opinion","_metadata":{"uid":"csc3fc14c11d9d2828"},"description":"\u003cp\u003eDespite having a diagnosis and a treatment plan, you may still want another specialist’s view. A second opinion doctor in Singapore can help you:\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eVerify your diagnosis and cancer stage.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eCompare alternative treatment options and their potential outcomes.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eUnderstand if newer or less invasive approaches may be appropriate.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eWeigh the benefits and risks of starting treatment now versus monitoring the condition.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eLearn about relevant clinical trials or research developments.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eWhen you seek a second opinion, you don’t have to disregard advice you’ve received from other doctors. Gathering more perspectives will help you to make an informed decision on your treatment. Our medical oncologists are ready to review your case, explain all your other options in detail, and help you decide on a plan that aligns with your needs and preferences.\u003c/p\u003e"},{"title":"How to Prepare for a Second Opinion Consultation","_metadata":{"uid":"cs58d49fbdb25d46e8"},"description":"\u003cp\u003eTo get meaningful insights from your second opinion doctor in Singapore, it’s best to come prepared. Here’s what you can do to prepare:\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eGather all your relevant medical records\u003c/strong\u003e, including any pathology reports, imaging results, blood test findings, and/or your initial doctor’s notes.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eList your current treatments and medications\u003c/strong\u003e, from your dosages to the side effects you’ve experienced.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ePrepare your questions\u003c/strong\u003e, like all the alternative treatments available, possible side effects, and/or the outlook for your specific condition.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eNote any symptoms or changes\u003c/strong\u003e, like when they began, their frequency, and triggers that make them better or worse.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eBring a family member or friend for emotional support\u003c/strong\u003e, and to help you document the discussion.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e"},{"title":"What to Expect During a Second Opinion Review","_metadata":{"uid":"cs0274d37864551c06"},"description":"\u003cp\u003eA second opinion consultation is an in-depth medical discussion where our oncologist analyses your case independently. During the review, you can expect:\u003c/p\u003e\u003col\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eA Step-By-Step Explanation of Your Current Diagnosis\u003c/strong\u003e\u003col\u003e\u003cli\u003eOur oncologist will go through your scans, lab results, and pathology findings in detail to ensure you understand how the diagnosis was reached.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ol\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eEvaluation of Treatment Rationale\u003c/strong\u003e\u003col\u003e\u003cli\u003eYou’ll hear the reasoning behind each recommended approach, including why certain treatments may be prioritised over others.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ol\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ePresentation of Additional Possibilities\u003c/strong\u003e\u003col\u003e\u003cli\u003eDepending on your case, our oncologist may outline different combinations of therapies, variations in treatment intensity, or emerging evidence that could be relevant.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ol\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMatching Treatment Recommendations to What Matters Most to You\u003c/strong\u003e\u003col\u003e\u003cli\u003eTreatment options will be considered in the context of your lifestyle, daily functioning, and long-term health considerations.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ol\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eClear Explanation of Uncertainties\u003c/strong\u003e\u003col\u003e\u003cli\u003eOur oncologist will clarify which aspects of your case are well-established and which may benefit from further testing or monitoring.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ol\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ol\u003e"}]},"showgradient":false}},{"one_pill_with_description_accordion_and_cta":{"title":"Oncologist Singapore: Types and Specialisations","_metadata":{"uid":"cs853fcb04b768363a"},"nav_title":"Types and Specialisations","description":"\u003cp\u003eCancer care involves multiple specialists, each focusing on a different part of diagnosis and treatment. Knowing the difference between them helps you reach the right treatment sooner, avoid unnecessary consultations, and ensure your care matches the complexity of your condition.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e","accordion_list":{"title":"Here's how you can differentiate","accordion_item":[{"title":"Difference Between a General Oncologist and a Medical Oncologist","_metadata":{"uid":"cs4513341764c8fe06"},"description":"\u003cp\u003eAn “oncologist” can refer to doctors who specialise in cancer care, but the scope of a general and medical oncologist may differ:\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eGeneral Oncologist:\u003c/strong\u003e Manages a broad range of cancer cases and may be more common in settings with fewer sub-specialists.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMedical Oncologist:\u003c/strong\u003e Focuses on treating cancer with medicines such as chemotherapy, targeted therapy, immunotherapy, and hormonal therapy. They often coordinate with surgical and radiation oncologists to plan comprehensive care.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e"},{"title":"Availability of Cancer Specialists in Singapore","_metadata":{"uid":"cs35626f3709237934"},"description":"\u003cp\u003eThere are a variety of cancer specialists in Singapore, including medical, surgical, and radiation oncologists. They may work in:\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eNational cancer centres and public hospitals.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003ePrivate oncology clinics and medical groups.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eSpecialist practices focusing on certain cancers, such as breast, lung, or gastrointestinal.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e"},{"title":"Choosing an Oncologist Based on Your Diagnosis","_metadata":{"uid":"cs4ebefef470b4f9f2"},"description":"\u003cp\u003eSelecting the right type of oncologist is about matching their expertise to your needs. You’ll want to consider:\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCancer Type and Stage\u003c/strong\u003e – Some cancers require sub-specialists, such as gynaecological oncologists for ovarian cancer or haematologists for blood cancers.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eTreatment Requirements\u003c/strong\u003e – If your care will primarily involve medication-based treatment, a medical oncologist will likely lead your plan. If surgery or radiotherapy is the main approach, you may first see those respective specialists.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAccess to Multidisciplinary Support\u003c/strong\u003e – The right oncologist can connect you with surgeons, radiologists, pathologists, and allied health professionals to ensure you receive coordinated care.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e"}]},"pill_video":null,"pill_image":{"uid":"blt9312b03ad70be9ca","_content_type_uid":"sys_assets","metadata":{"extension_uid":"blt98839f2d621515f6"},"asset":{"uid":"blt9312b03ad70be9ca","_version":1,"created_by":"blt974ab6796946f14d","updated_by":"blt974ab6796946f14d","created_at":"2025-08-25T03:34:18.446Z","updated_at":"2025-08-25T03:34:18.446Z","content_type":"image/png","file_size":"515980","filename":"TOCC_Oncologist.png","title":"TOCC_Oncologist.png","ACL":{},"parent_uid":null,"is_dir":false,"tags":[],"publish_details":{"time":"2025-08-26T02:12:47.950Z","user":"bltdae2747734443432","environment":"bltff9d25f6ec56a47a","locale":"en-gb"},"url":"https://images.contentstack.io/v3/assets/blt5f400315f9e4f0b3/blt9312b03ad70be9ca/68abd9ba25b61b72ac1588e7/TOCC_Oncologist.png?branch=prod"}},"pill_image_alignment":"left-aligned","cta":{"title":"Request for Appointment","cta_type":null,"site_page":[{"uid":"blte33e2de8b9c8e915","_content_type_uid":"form"}],"external_link":"","tracking_code":"","target":null},"showgradient":false}},{"left_aligned_title_with_accordion":{"title":"Finding the Right Oncologist for Your Condition","_metadata":{"uid":"csbfcdd58b073a6090"},"nav_title":"Finding the Right Oncologist","accordion_list":{"title":"","accordion_item":[{"title":"Questions to Ask During Your First Oncology Consultation","_metadata":{"uid":"cs34587b4bfd289ba8"},"description":"\u003cp\u003eIf you are not seeking a second opinion but attending a first consultation, these questions can help you prepare and make the most of your appointment.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eWhat is my exact diagnosis and stage of cancer?\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eWhat treatment options are available, and why are you recommending a particular approach?\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eWhat are the likely benefits and possible side effects of each option?\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eHow will treatment affect my daily activities and long-term health?\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eAre there clinical trials suitable for my condition?\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eHow will you coordinate with other specialists involved in my care?\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e"},{"title":"How Referrals Work in Singapore’s Healthcare System","_metadata":{"uid":"csd9fd70bfc58ed114"},"description":"\u003cp\u003eIn the public healthcare system, you usually need a referral to see a hospital-based oncologist. This referral can come from a polyclinic, a general practitioner, or another specialist. It ensures your medical history and test results are sent ahead so the oncologist can review them before your appointment.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eIn the private healthcare system, you can book an appointment directly with a clinic, whether for a first consultation or a second opinion. This can be helpful if you prefer a shorter waiting time or the flexibility to choose your oncologist. If you have insurance, check with your provider if your policy requires a referral for claims processing.\u003c/p\u003e"},{"title":"Public vs Private Options for Oncology Care","_metadata":{"uid":"cs6d6813643d264ae9"},"description":"\u003cp\u003eBoth public and private healthcare settings in Singapore offer oncology services, but they differ in how care is structured and delivered.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ePublic Hospitals:\u003c/strong\u003e Care is typically provided within larger, multidisciplinary cancer centres where specialists, nurses, and allied health professionals work together under one institution. You may be seen by different doctors over the course of your treatment, depending on availability and scheduling.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ePrivate Clinics:\u003c/strong\u003e Treatment may be overseen by a single oncologist who follows your case throughout. These clinics may coordinate with partner hospitals for procedures or therapies that require inpatient facilities or highly specialised equipment.\u003c/p\u003e"}]},"showgradient":false}},{"allied_health_professionals":{"title":"Our Oncologists","_metadata":{"uid":"csfafa3d33236f3855"},"nav_title":"Our Oncologists","professional":[{"uid":"bltbe921be1082f9d43","_content_type_uid":"doctor_page"},{"uid":"blte578b73422856edb","_content_type_uid":"doctor_page"},{"uid":"blt77242c6021ffd9b3","_content_type_uid":"doctor_page"},{"uid":"blt4c6479cd3071f17e","_content_type_uid":"doctor_page"},{"uid":"blt9c1213b47a828c22","_content_type_uid":"doctor_page"},{"uid":"bltc9027cf691214367","_content_type_uid":"doctor_page"}]}},{"left_aligned_title_with_accordion":{"title":"Our Services","_metadata":{"uid":"cs5dde72a3f610dc09"},"nav_title":"Our Services","accordion_list":{"title":"Here's How We Can Help","accordion_item":[{"title":"Diagnosis Work Up","_metadata":{"uid":"cs4c3c9ec1deabd12d"},"description":"\u003cp\u003eYour treatment journey begins with confirming your condition. A diagnostic work-up may include imaging scans, biopsies, and blood tests to determine the type, stage, and extent of the cancer. These results guide your oncologist in recommending a treatment plan suited to your condition and personal circumstances.\u003c/p\u003e"},{"title":"Chemotherapy","_metadata":{"uid":"cs738c09fcd64c2183"},"description":"\u003cp\u003eChemotherapy uses medicine to destroy cancer cells or stop them from growing. It may be given on its own or combined with other treatments such as surgery or radiotherapy, depending on your cancer type and stage.\u003c/p\u003e"},{"title":"Hormonal Therapy","_metadata":{"uid":"cs4e3772cbd7e1e461"},"description":"\u003cp\u003eFor hormone-sensitive cancers, such as certain breast or prostate cancers, hormonal therapy can help slow or stop cancer growth by lowering hormone levels or blocking their effects. It may be used before or after surgery, or as part of long-term treatment to reduce the risk of recurrence.\u003c/p\u003e"},{"title":"Targeted Therapy","_metadata":{"uid":"csff96029e6c18f245"},"description":"\u003cp\u003eTargeted therapy works by blocking specific molecules in cancer cells that are responsible for their growth and survival. This approach can slow the progression of the disease while limiting damage to healthy cells.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e"},{"title":"Immunotherapy","_metadata":{"uid":"csda5124a21a6ba38e"},"description":"\u003cp\u003eImmunotherapy helps your immune system recognise and attack cancer cells more effectively. It may be considered for gynaecological, lung, or skin cancers, where evidence shows a potential benefit.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e"},{"title":"Surgery","_metadata":{"uid":"csdd955aa1a013ae7e"},"description":"\u003cp\u003eSurgery for cancer involves removing tumours and any affected tissue to reduce or stop the spread of disease. Your oncologist will work with surgeons to determine if surgery is part of your treatment plan and whether a minimally invasive or open approach is the more suitable approach\u003c/p\u003e"}]},"showgradient":false}},{"one_pill_with_description_accordion_and_cta":{"title":"Why Thomson OncoCare Cancer Centre?","_metadata":{"uid":"cs6e66dc6daba8e3da"},"nav_title":"Why Us","description":"\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"color: rgb(0, 0, 0);\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan style=\"color: rgb(0, 0, 0);\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003eAt Thomson OncoCare Cancer Centre, your care is designed to be personalised, coordinated, and supportive throughout your cancer journey. Our approach combines clinical expertise, a streamlined care experience, and the welcoming environment you can expect from Thomson Medical.\u003c/p\u003e","accordion_list":{"title":"Why Thomson OncoCare Cancer Centre","accordion_item":[{"title":"A Partnership Rooted in Expertise \u0026 Innovation","_metadata":{"uid":"cs29f3a5d75f2d528d"},"description":"\u003cp\u003eThomson OncoCare Cancer Centre works in collaboration with \u003ca href=\"https://oncocare.sg/\" target=\"_self\"\u003eOncoCare Cancer Centre\u003c/a\u003e, one of Singapore’s largest private oncology groups. Together, we offer evidence-based treatments supported by ongoing research and a multidisciplinary approach that brings together oncology, surgery, and supportive care.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eOur team includes medical oncologists, palliative care specialists, and other healthcare professionals who work closely to align your treatment with your needs and overall health goals. This partnership allows you access to a wide range of treatment options while aiming to reduce unnecessary side effects.\u003cspan\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e"},{"title":"One-Stop Care","_metadata":{"uid":"csefe99dfde773aad6"},"description":"\u003cp\u003eCancer treatment can involve many moving parts — multiple specialists, different types of tests, and varied treatment sessions. At Thomson OncoCare Cancer Centre, these services are brought together in one location. From consultations and diagnostics to treatment sessions, you can access the care you need without having to travel between different facilities.\u003cspan style=\"color: rgb(0, 0, 0);\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan style=\"color: rgb(0, 0, 0);\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e"},{"title":"The Thomson Touch","_metadata":{"uid":"csffe2719fd60cd580"},"description":"\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"color: rgb(0, 0, 0);\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003eThe patient-first approach at Thomson Medical extends into Thomson OncoCare Cancer Centre. ","_metadata":{"uid":"cs3733789da54833a2"},"description":"\u003cp\u003eWe treat a wide range of cancers, including but not limited to:\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eColorectal cancer\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eGynaecological cancers (ovarian, cervical, uterine, etc.)\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eProstate and urological cancers\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eOur oncologists provide treatment plans tailored to your specific condition and needs.\u003c/p\u003e"},{"title":"What cancer treatments are available at Thomson OncoCare Cancer Centre?","_metadata":{"uid":"cs9fdfe09ff799c938"},"description":"\u003cp\u003eAt Thomson OncoCare Cancer Centre, you have access to a range of cancer treatments:\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eChemotherapy\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eTargeted Therapy\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eImmunotherapy\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eCancer Surgery\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003ePalliative Care and Pain Management\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eWe also work closely with specialist surgeons and radiotherapy providers so your treatment can be planned as part of a multidisciplinary approach.\u003c/p\u003e"},{"title":"How is Thomson OncoCare different from other cancer centres? ","_metadata":{"uid":"csd28cde2961658aea"},"description":"\u003cp\u003eWe combine the expertise of OncoCare Cancer Centre — one of Singapore’s largest private oncology groups — with a one-stop model that brings screenings, diagnostics, and treatments into one location.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e"},{"title":"Do I need a referral to consult an oncologist at Thomson OncoCare? ","_metadata":{"uid":"cs7c053e2cc9aba7d7"},"description":"\u003cp\u003eYou don’t need a referral to see our oncologists at Thomson OncoCare Cancer Centre. You may arrange a consultation with any of them directly. If your GP or another specialist has referred you, we’ll work with them to ensure your medical records and treatment information are shared, so your care continues without disruption.\u003c/p\u003e"},{"title":"What can I expect during my first consultation? ","_metadata":{"uid":"csd32b6c552b7e99cc"},"description":"\u003cp\u003eYour first consultation will typically include:\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eA detailed discussion about your medical history and concerns.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eReview of test results (if available) or recommendations for further diagnostic tests.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eA discussion on treatment options, potential side effects, and expected outcomes.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eA personalised treatment plan tailored to your condition.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eWe encourage patients to bring a family member or loved one for support.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e"},{"title":"Does Thomson OncoCare provide cancer screening services? ","_metadata":{"uid":"cs86c9473fb21d6ec9"},"description":"\u003cp\u003eYes, we offer a range of preventive screenings and early detection tests, including:\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMammograms \u0026amp; Breast Ultrasounds\u003c/strong\u003e (for breast cancer screening)\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ePap Smears \u0026amp; HPV Tests\u003c/strong\u003e (for cervical cancer)\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eColonoscopy \u0026amp; Stool Tests\u003c/strong\u003e (for colorectal cancer)\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eLung Cancer Screening\u003c/strong\u003e (for high-risk individuals)\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eSpeak to us about which screening is right for you or \u003ca href=\"https://www.thomsonmedical.com/thomson-specialists/health-screening\" target=\"_self\"\u003echeck out our health screening packages\u003c/a\u003e.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e"},{"title":"What supportive care services are available for cancer patients? ","_metadata":{"uid":"cs0c1c04ea050a07b9"},"description":"\u003cp\u003eWe believe in treating the whole person, not just the disease. Our supportive care includes:\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eNutritional Guidance\u003c/strong\u003e – Managing diet for strength \u0026amp; recovery.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ePain \u0026amp; Symptom Management\u003c/strong\u003e – Ensuring comfort at every stage.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ePalliative Care\u003c/strong\u003e – Enhancing quality of life for patients \u0026amp; families.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eEmotional \u0026amp; Psychological Support\u003c/strong\u003e – Helping patients cope with the challenges of cancer.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e"},{"title":"Are cancer treatments at Thomson OncoCare covered by insurance? ","_metadata":{"uid":"csf6e2dfccb4012b92"},"description":"\u003cp\u003eCancer treatments here may be covered under private health insurance plans and MediSave, depending on your policy. Our team can help you check your coverage and guide you through the claims process.\u003c/p\u003e"},{"title":"How much does it cost to see an oncologist in Singapore?","_metadata":{"uid":"csd15ba9dd20d0f1c8"},"description":"\u003cp\u003eWhat you pay for an oncology consultation depends on several factors, such as whether it’s your first visit or a follow-up, the oncologist’s experience, and the services included in the appointment. If you need diagnostic tests, imaging, or procedures, these will be charged separately. You can\u003ca href=\"tel:+65 6250 2222\" target=\"_self\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;contact us\u003c/a\u003e to discuss your needs, get an estimate, and check your insurance coverage.\u003c/p\u003e"},{"title":"Can I request a second opinion within the same hospital?","_metadata":{"uid":"cs71ca3c0c63baaa1c"},"description":"\u003cp\u003eYes, you can usually request a second opinion from another oncologist within the same hospital. In public hospitals, this may require a formal request and is subject to the doctor’s availability. In private hospitals or clinics, arranging to see a different oncologist is often more straightforward. You can \u003ca href=\"tel:+65 6250 2222\" target=\"_self\"\u003econtact us\u003c/a\u003e to discuss your situation and explore the options available to you.\u003c/p\u003e"}]},"showgradient":true}}],"seo":{"meta_title":"Thomson OncoCare Cancer Centre | Oncologists Singapore","meta_description":"At Thomson OncoCare Cancer Centre, we understand that a cancer diagnosis can feel overwhelming. Ophthalmologists employ various diagnostic tools, such as slit-lamp examinations and optical coherence tomography, to assess and manage eye health.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eOphthalmology is like architecture for the eyes. The eye is a complex structure with lenses, sensors, and nerves. Sometimes, people are born with or develop issues like blurry vision (refractive errors), cloudy lenses (cataracts), or damage to the optic nerve (glaucoma).\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eOphthalmologists are skilled specialists who diagnose and treat these conditions using advanced techniques, including surgery and specialised medications. They also address problems affecting how the eyes function, such as disorders of eye movement or coordination.\u003c/p\u003e","description_sub_groups":{"sub_group":[]},"pill_video":null,"pill_image":{"uid":"bltf1029a0c8397437c","_version":2,"is_dir":false,"ACL":{},"content_type":"image/jpeg","created_at":"2025-01-17T12:07:16.756Z","created_by":"blt562fc948386333b7","file_size":"11764824","filename":"Dr_Don_Pek_Consult_2.jpg","parent_uid":null,"tags":[],"title":"Dr Don Pek Consult 2.jpg","updated_at":"2025-01-17T12:10:36.137Z","updated_by":"blt562fc948386333b7","publish_details":{"time":"2025-01-17T12:10:41.355Z","user":"blt562fc948386333b7","environment":"bltff9d25f6ec56a47a","locale":"en-gb"},"url":"https://images.contentstack.io/v3/assets/blt5f400315f9e4f0b3/bltf1029a0c8397437c/678a47f49d626efd8f11b62a/Dr_Don_Pek_Consult_2.jpg?branch=prod"},"pill_image_alignment":"right-aligned","cta":[{"title":"Make an Enquiry","_metadata":{"uid":"cs241829671edbc067"},"cta_type":"button","site_page":[{"uid":"blte4bd75765e0e692c","_content_type_uid":"form"}],"external_link":"","tracking_code":"","target":"_self"},{"title":"Request Appointment","_metadata":{"uid":"cs8cd0d3e19a7eab4a"},"cta_type":"button","site_page":[],"external_link":"https://www.thomsonmedical.com/appointment?location=Thomson+Specialists+Woodleigh+%28Eye+Health%29\u0026doctor=","tracking_code":"","target":"_self"}],"stamp_image":null}},{"one_pill_with_description_accordion_and_cta":{"title":"Eye \u0026 Ophthalmological Services at Thomson Specialists","_metadata":{"uid":"csdab46c7a66b0cebd"},"nav_title":"Ophthalmological Services","description":"\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003c/span\u003eFrom routine eye exams to advanced surgical procedures, we offer a\u003cspan\u003e range of Eye \u0026amp; Whether you're looking to delay parenthood for personal or medical reasons, our comprehensive services provide the support and options you need\u003c/p\u003e","description_sub_groups":{"sub_group":[]},"pill_image":{"uid":"blt356515c327853a69","_content_type_uid":"sys_assets","metadata":{"preset":{},"extension_uid":"blt98839f2d621515f6"},"asset":{"_version":1,"is_dir":false,"uid":"blt356515c327853a69","ACL":{},"content_type":"image/png","created_at":"2023-10-02T14:58:23.623Z","created_by":"blt5426ba4b039b9b11","file_size":"1197106","filename":"fertility-parenthood.png","parent_uid":"blt81aac2649825c739","tags":[],"title":"fertility-parenthood.png","updated_at":"2023-10-02T14:58:23.623Z","updated_by":"blt5426ba4b039b9b11","publish_details":{"environment":"bltff9d25f6ec56a47a","locale":"en-gb","time":"2023-11-06T07:11:12.906Z","user":"blt25ec137c0f059a4c"},"url":"https://images.contentstack.io/v3/assets/blt5f400315f9e4f0b3/blt356515c327853a69/651ada8f375d98e7ce9cd709/fertility-parenthood.png?branch=prod"}},"pill_image_alignment":"right-aligned","cta":[],"stamp_image":{}}},{"one_pill_with_description_accordion_and_cta":{"title":"Motherhood on your own terms","_metadata":{"uid":"csb016f4d08ad1838b"},"nav_title":"Egg Freezing","description":"\u003cp\u003eEgg freezing, scientifically called oocyte cryopreservation, is a technique for women to retrieve, freeze, and store eggs for later use. These frozen eggs stay as healthy as they were when they were frozen, providing flexibility and peace of mind for future family planning.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cbr/\u003e\u003cp\u003eAt Thomson Fertility Centre, we understand that every woman has unique circumstances and wishes to chart her path to motherhood at her own pace. With over 40 years of experience in obstetrics, gynaecology, and paediatrics, our team is dedicated to providing the support and guidance you need throughout your journey.\u003c/p\u003e","accordion_list":{"title":" ","accordion_item":[{"title":"Why choose Egg Freezing?","_metadata":{"uid":"cscdef3ff0d4126461"},"description":"\u003cp\u003eMany individuals are opting to delay parenthood for personal or career-related reasons. Egg Freezing offers a promising solution, allowing women to safeguard healthy eggs for future family planning.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cp\u003eSome women choose to freeze their eggs for future use if there is a medical reason involving a permanent impact on their fertility. These reasons may include:\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cli\u003eGynaecological surgery affecting the ovaries, uterus, and/or fallopian tubes.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eChemotherapy treatment, which can harm a woman's eggs.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003ePelvic region radiotherapy that may induce premature menopause.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cp\u003eEgg freezing provides an opportunity to preserve eggs before they are damaged or depleted due to medical treatments, ensuring the possibility of future conception.\u003c/p\u003e"},{"title":"Elective Egg Freezing in Singapore","_metadata":{"uid":"cs9a563eb48df4c8a7"},"description":"\u003cp\u003eStarting from 1 July 2023, women aged between 21 and 37 can legally freeze their eggs for non-medical reasons in Singapore through Elective Egg Freezing, a service available at Thomson Fertility Centre.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cp\u003eRecent findings have shown that the success rates of egg freezing and the use of frozen eggs remain steady for women up to 37 years of age (\u003ca href=\"https://www.straitstimes.com/singapore/from-july-age-limit-for-women-to-opt-for-elective-egg-freezing-donation-will-be-raised-from-35-to-37\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eSource: The Straits Times\u003c/a\u003e).\u003c/p\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eImportant Note: Only legally married couples can use their frozen eggs for In Vitro Fertilisation (IVF) attempts.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e"},{"title":"How does Egg Freezing work? ","_metadata":{"uid":"csee46cce8affbf09c"},"description":"\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe Egg Freezing process is akin to the initial stages of an IVF cycle. It begins with daily hormone injections to stimulate egg growth until they reach a mature stage for retrieval. Once retrieved, the eggs are carefully frozen and stored until the woman is ready to \u003c/span\u003etry for a baby.\u003c/p\u003e"}]},"pill_image":{"uid":"blt9bae377e9e7061e5","_content_type_uid":"sys_assets","metadata":{"preset":{},"extension_uid":"blt98839f2d621515f6"},"asset":{"_version":1,"is_dir":false,"uid":"blt9bae377e9e7061e5","ACL":{},"content_type":"image/png","created_at":"2023-10-02T14:58:54.018Z","created_by":"blt5426ba4b039b9b11","file_size":"1121825","filename":"fertility-motherhood.png","parent_uid":"blt81aac2649825c739","tags":[],"title":"fertility-motherhood.png","updated_at":"2023-10-02T14:58:54.018Z","updated_by":"blt5426ba4b039b9b11","publish_details":{"environment":"bltff9d25f6ec56a47a","locale":"en-gb","time":"2023-11-06T07:11:12.797Z","user":"blt25ec137c0f059a4c"},"url":"https://images.contentstack.io/v3/assets/blt5f400315f9e4f0b3/blt9bae377e9e7061e5/651adaae1d2dc319e2fb8808/fertility-motherhood.png?branch=prod"}},"pill_image_alignment":"left-aligned","cta":{"title":"Learn More","cta_type":"button","site_page":[],"external_link":"https://thomsoneggfreezing.sg/","tracking_code":"","target":"_blank"},"showgradient":false}},{"one_pill_with_description_images_and_ctas":{"title":"Preserving male fertility for future dads","_metadata":{"uid":"cse552ac6d6220ceea"},"nav_title":"Sperm Freezing","description":"\u003cp\u003eSperm Freezing is an equally vital option for men who need to safeguard their fertility due to various medical reasons. This process involves collecting and freezing semen, which contains sperm, before embarking on treatments like chemotherapy, radiotherapy, or surgical procedures.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eBy freezing and storing sperm, men can ensure that they have the option to become fathers in the future, even after undergoing treatments that may impact their fertility. Sperm Freezing provides the reassurance that healthy sperm will be available when the time is right for family planning.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eAt Thomson Fertility Centre, we are committed to offering comprehensive fertility preservation options, including Sperm Freezing, to empower individuals on their unique paths to parenthood.\u003c/p\u003e","description_sub_groups":{"sub_group":[]},"pill_image":{"uid":"blt01404bf22389e90c","_content_type_uid":"sys_assets","metadata":{"preset":{},"extension_uid":"blt98839f2d621515f6"},"asset":{"_version":1,"is_dir":false,"uid":"blt01404bf22389e90c","ACL":{},"content_type":"image/png","created_at":"2023-10-02T14:59:12.550Z","created_by":"blt5426ba4b039b9b11","file_size":"888698","filename":"fertility-fatherhood.png","parent_uid":"blt81aac2649825c739","tags":[],"title":"fertility-fatherhood.png","updated_at":"2023-10-02T14:59:12.550Z","updated_by":"blt5426ba4b039b9b11","publish_details":{"environment":"bltff9d25f6ec56a47a","locale":"en-gb","time":"2023-11-06T07:11:12.682Z","user":"blt25ec137c0f059a4c"},"url":"https://images.contentstack.io/v3/assets/blt5f400315f9e4f0b3/blt01404bf22389e90c/651adac09f3cb123a254f2c3/fertility-fatherhood.png?branch=prod"}},"pill_image_alignment":"right-aligned","cta":[],"stamp_image":{}}},{"centered_aligned_info_block_with_cta":{"title":"Let our team of experts guide you","_metadata":{"uid":"csc1ce82b5194ac230"},"nav_title":"","description":"\u003cp\u003eUndergoing fertility treatments can be overwhelming, and we know it may not be easy for you and your partner. fertility process for your peace of mind","_metadata":{"uid":"cs761fb269ce69f3fa"},"nav_title":"Understanding IVF","description":"\u003cp\u003eIn-Vitro Fertilisation (IVF) is a widely-used Assisted Reproductive Technology (ART) treatment designed to help couples conceive, by combining eggs and sperm in a specialised laboratory to create embryos. These embryos are then carefully selected and transferred into the woman's uterus, increasing the chances of a successful pregnancy.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cp\u003eAt Thomson Fertility Centre, we are dedicated to making this journey as straightforward and reassuring as possible. We believe in simplifying the IVF process to reduce any added pressure or stress you may be feeling. This approach not only improves efficiency but also minimises the risk of communication errors, ensuring a smoother journey.\u003c/p\u003e","accordion_list":{"title":"Fertility Treatments","accordion_item":[{"title":"Assisted Hatching","_metadata":{"uid":"cs878549c866a7db7b"},"description":"\u003cp\u003eThomson Fertility Centre is pleased to offer an assisted hatching service on embryos to our patients before embryo transfer in the attempt to improve implantation rates. The unsuccessful implantation of embryos may be the result of an inefficient hatching process.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cbr/\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat is Assisted Hatching?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cp\u003eHatching is the process by which the blastocyst (a day-5 embryo) escapes from the zona pellucida (the “shell” of the embryo) before implantation. Hatching may occur on about day 6 or 7 of embryo development. Some embryos are unable to hatch, possibly attributed to the “shell” being too thick or hardened.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cbr/\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhy is Assisted Hatching recommended?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eWhile some studies have reported improved pregnancy rates after assisted hatching, others found the treatment to be ineffective. It has been shown to improve implantation rates for specific groups of patients with:\u003c/p\u003e\u003cbr/\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eEmbryos that have thick or hardened zona pellucida.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eTransfer of frozen-thawed embryos (\u003cem\u003eBalaban et al., 2006, Martins et al., 2011\u003c/em\u003e).\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe woman’s age being more than 38 years.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eBasal follicle stimulating hormone (FSH) level of \u0026gt; 10 mIU/mL.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003ePrevious implantation failure after an IVF/ ICSI cycle (\u003cem\u003eHerslag et al., 1999\u003c/em\u003e).\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cbr/\u003e\u003cp\u003eTherefore, if you and/or your embryos falls into at least one of the conditions mentioned above, you may benefit from the assisted hatching procedure.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e"},{"title":"Blastocyst Culture and Transfer","_metadata":{"uid":"cs4f750ba1f0bcf2d5"},"description":"\u003cstrong\u003eWhat is a blastocyst?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cp\u003eIn the natural cycle, the egg is fertilised in the fallopian tube (or oviduct) and undergoes several cell divisions before reaching the blastocyst stage (see right side of picture) on day 5 which contains hundreds of cells. The blastocyst consists of two cell populations – the inner cell mass which is the precursor of the foetus and trophectoderm which helps the embryo to implant and form the placenta.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cbr/\u003e\u003cp\u003eThe blastocyst enters the womb (uterus) five or six days after fertilisation during which the endometrium is receptive to implantation. Therefore, the transfer of a blastocyst is believed to be more physiologically synchronised with the window of implantation.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://thomsonfertility.com.sg/wp-content/uploads/image025.png\" width=\"502\" height=\"303\" max-width=\"502\" style=\"max-width: 502px;width: 502;height: 303;\"/\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e"},{"title":"Embryo Freezing","_metadata":{"uid":"csdcee686aa851390c"},"description":"\u003cp\u003eThomson Fertility Centre is pleased to offer our patients the facility to freeze and store any remaining suitable embryos resulting from a fresh cycle, an embryo freezing technique used in IVF centres all over the world.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cbr/\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhy do you need embryo freezing?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eThe purpose of freezing your spare embryos is to store them for future embryo transfer procedures. For example, if you did not get pregnant after embryo transfer in the IVF cycle, or if your IVF cycle is successful but you wish to have another baby after this pregnancy, you could have your embryos thawed and transferred into the uterus instead of undergoing the whole IVF programme again.\u003c/p\u003e"},{"title":"Intracytoplasmic Sperm Injections (ICSI)","_metadata":{"uid":"cs80a27586703a4a36"},"description":"\u003cstrong\u003eWhat is ICSI?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cp\u003eICSI is an invasive procedure where a single sperm is selected and directly injected into the egg crossing the egg shell (zona pellucida) and the oolemma (the outer membrane of the egg) in order to enhance fertilisation.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cbr/\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat are the benefits of ICSI?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cp\u003eICSI helps to achieve fertilisation in patients with low sperm count or poor sperm motility and morphology (i.e. testicular sperm). It is also recommended for those patients who have defective egg shells, preventing the sperm from entering the egg; or for those who have a history of proven unsuccessful fertilisation with conventional IVF. When there is no fertilisation, it means the sperm is unable to achieve fertilisation on its own.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cbr/\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eIs there a difference in pregnancy outcomes with ICSI or IVF?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cp\u003eThe pregnancy outcome after ICSI is similar to that of IVF. Studies show no greater miscarriage, stillbirth or pre-natal death rates among the ICSI pregnancies.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cbr/\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eIs there any risk of abnormality in children conceived using this procedure?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cp\u003eStudies have shown that there is no major difference between the children born by IVF and ICSI. The small risk of foetal abnormalities may also occur with normal pregnancies. There could also be other risks not associated with the procedure itself; such as the sperm carrying chromosomal anomaly and transmission of a genetic defect.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cbr/\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhy would I need ICSI?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cp\u003eUnsuccessful fertilisation could be due to a problem of the egg, sperm or sometimes both. To a large extent, ICSI helps to overcome this problem. ICSI could be helpful for you when you have:\u003cbr/\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eVery low sperm count.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eVery low sperm motility.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eSperm surgically retrieved from testis or epididymis, which do not have the capacity to penetrate the egg shell and fertilise.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003ePrior failed cycles due to poor or no fertilisation.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eVery few eggs retrieved.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cbr/\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCan ICSI be done for all my eggs?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cp\u003eICSI can be done for all your eggs. However, if you have a large number of eggs retrieved, the eggs can be split into two groups. Conventional IVF and ICSI can be done separately after discussion with you and your partner if you have a history of unexplained fertility conditions.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cbr/\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eIs there any difference in the day of embryo transfer procedure for embryos that have gone through ICSI?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cp\u003eThere is no difference in the embryo transfer procedure or the day of embryo transfer regardless of whether your embryos have gone through ICSI or IVF. The embryos are gently placed in the uterus using a thin tube. This is usually a painless procedure lasting only about five to 10 minutes.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cbr/\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eIs consent for doing ICSI on eggs needed?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cp\u003ePrior written consent by both partners will be required if you wish for ICSI to be performed.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cbr/\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHow is ICSI done?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cp\u003eIn ICSI, a single sperm is injected into each egg using micromanipulation under an inverted microscope. This is a highly-sophisticated procedure requiring special skills and equipment.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cbr/\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWill ICSI procedure cause any damage to my eggs?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cp\u003eDamage due to the procedure itself is almost nil in skilful hands. However, as ICSI is an invasive procedure, there will still be a small amount of risk of damage to the eggs.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cbr/\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eIs treatment required before and after transfer of embryos that have undergone ICSI different from routine embryo transfer?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cp\u003eNo, there is no difference in treatment compared to routine IVF and embryo transfer. You will be given the same hormone injections as for IVF before egg retrieval. Hormone injections to support the lining of the uterus will also be given as after routine embryo transfer.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cbr/\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat is the success rate of ICSI?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cp\u003eICSI offers a fertilisation rate of 60 to 70 per cent. Once fertilisation is achieved, the pregnancy rate is the same as conventional IVF. That is, the success rate is related to the number of embryos transferred, the causes of infertility and the age of the woman. No pregnancy can be guaranteed with ICSI.\u003c/p\u003e"},{"title":"Preimplantation Genetic Diagnosis (PGD)","_metadata":{"uid":"cs446e5458fd700eb5"},"description":"\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat is Preimplantation Genetic Diagnosis (PGD)?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003ePreimplantation genetic diagnosis (PGD) is a procedure to test embryos for genetic disorders or chromosomal abnormalities before implantation.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWho should consider PGD?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003ePGD is usually performed when either of the couple carry the risk of certain heritable diseases or disorders and wants to prevent it from being passed on to the child. It may also be opted for by couples older in age or had recurrent miscarriages, in order to improve pregnancy rates by identifying the ‘normal’ embryo(s) for the transfer.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHow is PGD performed?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eBlood samples are taken from affected couples to develop a testing system specific to the couple. The couple has to undergo IVF treatment, irrespective of their fertility status. Embryos will be created by fertilising the eggs of the wife with the sperm of the husband.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eWhen the embryos reach a stage of many cells, 2 cells will be extracted from each embryo and tested for specific genetic abnormality. Normal embryos will be transferred to the uterus of the wife.\u003c/p\u003e"}]},"pill_image":{"uid":"blta83018e224f89552","_content_type_uid":"sys_assets","metadata":{"preset":{},"extension_uid":"blt98839f2d621515f6"},"asset":{"_version":1,"is_dir":false,"uid":"blta83018e224f89552","ACL":{},"content_type":"image/png","created_at":"2023-10-02T11:48:19.879Z","created_by":"blt5426ba4b039b9b11","file_size":"1244247","filename":"ivf-understanding-ivf.png","parent_uid":"blt81aac2649825c739","tags":[],"title":"ivf-understanding-ivf.png","updated_at":"2023-10-02T11:48:19.879Z","updated_by":"blt5426ba4b039b9b11","publish_details":{"environment":"bltff9d25f6ec56a47a","locale":"en-gb","time":"2023-11-06T07:11:14.041Z","user":"blt25ec137c0f059a4c"},"url":"https://images.contentstack.io/v3/assets/blt5f400315f9e4f0b3/blta83018e224f89552/651aae03f64f1510c8b45a74/ivf-understanding-ivf.png?branch=prod"}},"pill_image_alignment":"right-aligned","cta":{"title":"Find a Fertility Expert","cta_type":"button","site_page":[],"external_link":"/find-an-expert?sub_specialization=Obstetrics+%26+Gynaecology+%28O%26G%29+-+Fertility","target":"_self"},"showgradient":false}},{"one_pill_with_description_accordion_and_cta":{"title":"Learn about our IVF Programme","_metadata":{"uid":"cs8f9cf1c2e3dd896b"},"nav_title":"Stages of IVF","description":"","accordion_list":{"title":"The 4 phases of our IVF Programme","accordion_item":[{"title":"Phase 0: Preparation","_metadata":{"uid":"csc1a20c9a0a28c280"},"description":"\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eTypically takes about a month.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cbr/\u003e\u003cp\u003eYour journey is beginning, and we're here to support you every step of the way.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cbr/\u003e\u003cp\u003eOur first consultation, typically scheduled between cycle days 2-4, helps us to assess your clinical situation and fine-tune the programme to your needs. We may prescribe oral contraceptive pills (OCP) to ensure hormonal stability and streamline the IVF process.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cbr/\u003e\u003cp\u003eIf certain conditions are met, Phase 0 may be skipped and you can proceed directly into Phase 1.\u003c/p\u003e"},{"title":"Phase 1: Egg Growth","_metadata":{"uid":"cs7d22bc93facd8ba6"},"description":"\u003cem\u003eTypically 10 to 14 days, and ends when enough eggs are fully grown.\u003c/em\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIn Phase 1, we further nurture your journey towards parenthood.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eYou'll return on day 2 or 3 of your menstrual cycle following the course of oral contraceptive pills (OCPs). This ensures that everything is primed and ready before we begin hormone treatment.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHormone stimulation\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eDaily hormone injections become a part of your routine during this phase, with easy-to-use pen injectors that make self-injections hassle-free. These injections are designed to stimulate the growth of approximately 10 eggs.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ePersonalised care\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003eYour dedicated IVF clinician will handle all your scans and procedures, providing personalised care and attention. Blood tests are rarely needed at this point."},{"title":"Phase 2: Procedures","_metadata":{"uid":"csdce141dc7955d484"},"description":"\u003cp\u003eThis is the stage where the main extraction and fertilisation procedures happen.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cbr/\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eEgg Extraction (Oocyte Pick-up - OPU)\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eA brief 10- to 20-minute procedure.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eThis is typically performed under mild, short-acting anaesthetic, and you will usually be well enough to return home after just two hours.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cbr/\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eFertilisation Process\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eYour eggs are carefully combined with your partner's sperm in our laboratory. \u003cspan\u003eIntracytoplasmic Sperm Injection (ICSI), where individual sperms are injected to each egg, is performed if the sperm count is very low. Otherwise, the sperm and egg are allowed to fertilise naturally.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cbr/\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eEmbryo Transfer (ET)\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003c/span\u003eAfter three days of nurturing, the 'best' two or three embryos are selected. A straightforward 10-minute procedure transfers these embryos back into your womb.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cbr/\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://thomsonfertility.com.sg/wp-content/uploads/image028.gif\" width=\"416\" height=\"316\" max-width=\"416\" style=\"max-width: 416px;width: 416;height: 316;\"/\u003e"},{"title":"Phase 3: Womb Stabilisation","_metadata":{"uid":"cscf6d5a296187d7ae"},"description":"\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003ePeriod of 2 weeks.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cbr/\u003e\u003cp\u003eDuring this phase, various hormones are carefully administered. This crucial phase helps maintain a stable environment in the womb, preparing it for potential pregnancy.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cbr/\u003e\u003cp\u003eAs you progress through this phase, our dedicated team is here to support you. Your well-being and comfort remain our top priorities as you await the pregnancy test and take one step closer towards parenthood.\u003c/p\u003e"}]},"pill_image":{"uid":"bltc1fc6aac98ab7af4","_content_type_uid":"sys_assets","metadata":{"preset":{},"extension_uid":"blt98839f2d621515f6"},"asset":{"_version":1,"is_dir":false,"uid":"bltc1fc6aac98ab7af4","ACL":{},"content_type":"image/png","created_at":"2023-10-02T11:09:30.501Z","created_by":"blt5426ba4b039b9b11","file_size":"1369387","filename":"ivf-stages-of-ivf.png","parent_uid":"blt81aac2649825c739","tags":[],"title":"ivf-stages-of-ivf.png","updated_at":"2023-10-02T11:09:30.501Z","updated_by":"blt5426ba4b039b9b11","publish_details":{"environment":"bltff9d25f6ec56a47a","locale":"en-gb","time":"2023-11-06T07:11:27.334Z","user":"blt25ec137c0f059a4c"},"url":"https://images.contentstack.io/v3/assets/blt5f400315f9e4f0b3/bltc1fc6aac98ab7af4/651aa4ea3df501bcb45eb028/ivf-stages-of-ivf.png?branch=prod"}},"pill_image_alignment":"left-aligned","cta":{"title":"Enquire Our orthopaedic sports medicine services for women include:\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eACL Reconstruction\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eSurgical repair of the anterior cruciate ligament (ACL), commonly injured in sports involving sudden stops and changes in direction.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMeniscus Repair\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eSurgery to repair or remove torn meniscus cartilage in the knee, often due to twisting injuries.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eRotator Cuff Repair\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eSurgical repair of torn rotator cuff tendons in the shoulder, frequently caused by repetitive overhead activities.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eLabral Repair\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eReattachment of a torn labrum in the shoulder or hip to restore stability and function.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAchilles Tendon Repair\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eSurgery to repair a ruptured Achilles tendon, often resulting from acute sports injuries.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eTennis Elbow (Lateral Epicondylitis) Surgery\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eRemoval of damaged tissue and repair of the extensor tendon to relieve pain and restore function.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ePatellar Tendon Repair\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eSurgical repair of the patellar tendon in the knee, often required after acute injury.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHip Arthroscopy\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eMinimally invasive procedure to treat labral tears, impingement, and other hip joint issues.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eStress Fracture Management\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eTreatment of stress fractures common in athletes, involving rest, bracing, and in some cases, surgical intervention.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCartilage Restoration\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eTechniques play.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eOur orthopaedic sports medicine services for women aim to treat injuries, promote recovery, and enhance performance, enabling women to After your scan is complete, our radiologists promptly analyze the results, and you return for a follow-up consultation with your doctor that same afternoon to discuss your suitable treatment options.\u003c/p\u003e\u003ch6\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWho benefits from same-day MRI scan?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h6\u003e\u003cp\u003eThis service is particularly beneficial for:\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eOffice workers who can only take a single day off from work for medical appointments\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eBusy professionals with limited scheduling flexibility\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003ePatients with urgent diagnostic needs who require prompt results\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eIndividuals who prefer to complete their medical process in one visit rather than multiple trips\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003ePeople who experience anxiety about medical results and prefer not to wait days or weeks for answers\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eThose with time-sensitive treatment decisions who need quick diagnostic information\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e","cta_group":[{"cta_title":"Schedule a MRI Scan","_metadata":{"uid":"cs5808c9e819d68a69"},"cta_type":"button","site_page":[],"external_link":"https://www.thomsonmedical.com/appointment?doctor=Dr+Jerry+Chen","target":"_blank","tracking_code":""}],"show_gradient":false,"mobile_scrollable":false}},{"left_aligned_title_with_accordion":{"title":"Frequently Asked Questions","_metadata":{"uid":"cscfa142000eba4e73"},"nav_title":"FAQ","accordion_list":{"title":"FAQ","accordion_item":[{"title":"Do I need to book an appointment?","_metadata":{"uid":"cs3ba346f308f9bcb8"},"description":"\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eUrgent care: \u003c/strong\u003eNo appointment is required. Walk-ins are welcome 24/7.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eNon-urgent services: \u003c/strong\u003eFor vaccinations and other non-urgent services, we recommend booking an appointment to minimise your wait time.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eTo schedule an appointment, you can fill up the \u003ca href=\"https://www.thomsonmedical.com/appointment \" target=\"_blank\"\u003eappointment request form\u003c/a\u003e or call us at 6350 8812.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eOur team is ready to provide you with prompt, professional care for all your healthcare needs.\u003c/p\u003e"},{"title":"What do I need to bring to Thomson Medical UCC?","_metadata":{"uid":"cs22986906497205be"},"description":"\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eNRIC / identity card\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eAny referral letters, X-Rays, or previous medical reports (optional)\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e"},{"title":"Does Thomson Medical provide ambulance services?","_metadata":{"uid":"csafce7a80944b4034"},"description":"\u003cp\u003eWe do not provide ambulance services for the general public. Our ambulance service is reserved for internal patient transfers only.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eFor medical emergencies requiring immediate transportation to a hospital, please call 995 for the public emergency ambulance service. If you need non-emergency ambulance transport, we recommend contacting a private ambulance service provider.\u003c/p\u003e"},{"title":"How do I claim from my insurance at Thomson Medical?","_metadata":{"uid":"cs49137bbf196d6af2"},"description":"\u003cp\u003eFor outpatient services at Thomson Medical, insurance claims typically aren't available.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eHowever, for inpatient cases, the process involves verifying whether the doctor handling your case is part of your insurance provider's approved panel. Once confirmed, the necessary documentation and claims can be processed in accordance with your insurance policy's guidelines. It's always advisable to check with your insurance provider beforehand to understand the specifics of your coverage and ensure a smooth claims process.\u003c/p\u003e"},{"title":"What if my condition is too severe for the Urgent Care Centre?","_metadata":{"uid":"csd10c66819869cda5"},"description":"\u003cp\u003eOur care team will assess your condition and arrange for an ambulance transfer to an Emergency Department if necessary.\u003c/p\u003e"},{"title":"What is the difference between urgent and emergency care?","_metadata":{"uid":"cs35a328eeeb7224d4"},"description":"\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eUrgent\u003c/strong\u003e care is for \u003cstrong\u003enon-life-threatening\u003c/strong\u003e conditions that require prompt attention but are not emergencies. This includes issues like minor fractures, sprains, moderate fever, or ear infections.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eEmergency\u003c/strong\u003e care is for \u003cstrong\u003eserious, life-threatening\u003c/strong\u003e conditions that need immediate medical intervention. Examples include chest pain, severe breathing difficulties, major trauma, or stroke symptoms.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eFor a more comprehensive understanding of when to choose urgent care, emergency care, or a GP visit, please \u003ca href=\"https://www.thomsonmedical.com/blog/health/urgent-care-centre-ae-gp-24-hour-clinic\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eread our detailed guide here\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e"}]},"showgradient":true}},{"map_embed_with_location_details":{"title":"Locate Us","_metadata":{"uid":"cs1ab246ba7d94574a"},"nav_title":"Locate Us","locations":{"location":[{"uid":"blte04e130b2e562bae","_content_type_uid":"clinic"}]}}},{"cards_carousel":{"title":"You may like this","_metadata":{"uid":"cs2e813691d3f2bb6e"},"nav_title":"","cards":[{"short_title":"","_metadata":{"uid":"csd6d9a9e358fce7e7"},"image":null,"page":[{"uid":"bltf09c16624a47e956","_content_type_uid":"landing_page"}],"hash_id":"","external_link":""},{"short_title":"","_metadata":{"uid":"cs6af82cf1854d0c1f"},"image":null,"page":[{"uid":"bltbdfb7e01ab45cacd","_content_type_uid":"landing_page"}],"hash_id":"","external_link":""},{"short_title":"","_metadata":{"uid":"csf20c93e6f0cec9a9"},"image":null,"page":[{"uid":"blt20e26d673b77c84f","_content_type_uid":"landing_page"}],"hash_id":"","external_link":""}]}}],"seo":{"meta_title":"24-Hr Urgent Care Centre | Thomson Medical Centre UCC","meta_description":"Thomson Medical's 24-Hour Urgent Care Centre (UCC) is conveniently located in Novena. 5.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eMany parents have the misconception that their children do not need to visit a dentist in Singapore since their kids’ baby teeth will fall out eventually. However, your child’s dental care is an essential aspect of their overall health because poor dental can increase the risk of respiratory infections since the bacteria from the mouth can be inhaled into the lungs.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eWe recommend finding a dentist that your child feels comfortable with every visit if you want your child to grow up with a healthy and beautiful smile. The Singapore Dental Association recommends that parents bring children to a dentist for their first visit soon after the first baby tooth comes in.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eAt Thomson Dental Centre, we love seeing children at our practice. We look forward to seeing kids’ faces light up with smiles. Our trained paediatric dentists with credible background experience will do their best to help patients feel happy and positive about their visits. Feel free to consult our dentists for any questions related to your child's oral health.\u003c/p\u003e","accordion_list":{"title":"Key information","accordion_item":[{"title":"When to make an appointment?","_metadata":{"uid":"csa0c0e1ee9505d945"},"description":"\u003cp\u003eWe recommend scheduling your child's first dental appointment as soon as their first teeth erupt, typically around the age of one. Our dedicated team of dentists is committed to providing excellent service and ensuring your child's comfort throughout the visit. Depending on your child's age, our dentist will conduct a comprehensive examination of their teeth and gums to ensure proper development. If necessary, gentle teeth cleaning may be provided.\u003c/p\u003e"},{"title":"How to prepare your child for their first dental positive.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eHelp your child understand that having their teeth and gums checked is beneficial.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eDon'ts:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eAvoid using dental visits as punishments.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eSteer clear of scary stories about visiting the dentist.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eRefrain from bribing your child into going to the dentist for their first visit, as it may cause apprehension.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eEstablishing a positive precedent for dental appointments during your child's early years is
